strings.Value: [Attack] "You shouldn't have interfered with my servants."
"I recognize your right to revenge, and this is your business. But I'm not helping you."
"Deal. You will be my new master."
"I respect our deal with Nazrielle. You're going to jail."
"You've been spoiling Nazrielle's work, haven't you?"

{n}Sartayne gazes at you in astonishment. Something seems different. No longer does he appear dim-witted and servile. Instead he seems self-confident and firm.{/n} "I didn't expect to see you here. How can I help you?"

"When I found out the rascal was here, I decided to seize the opportunity. I arrived here, got myself an apprentice's position... and set my hands to work. I'm smarter and more skilled than she might think. I worked hard by the anvil during the day and crafted cursed items at nights. Nazrielle's pride is her soft spot – the perfect place to strike. I decided to tarnish her image, make her look clumsy and incompetent, ruin her reputation. And, of course, destroy that masterpiece she's been making such a fuss over..."
"That's a shame. Now if you'll excuse me, I have to go. If you managed to find me here, Nazrielle will too. Tell the lousy skunk I quit. But she'd better run like hell. I will have my revenge."

{n}Sartayne's laugh rings out.{/n} "So that's how it is. As soon as I take over Nazrielle's workshop, I promise, I will forge things you've never even dreamed of! And its former owner will receive some proper training, I give you my word. I'll begin by bringing some guards to the blacksmith shop and suppress any thoughts she has of resistance. Goodbye, {mf|Your Grace|Your Grace|Your Highness|Your Highness}."
"I'll be right here should you want to talk."

"I'd hoped to see Nazrielle's head on the chopping block, but since you're here, I have a better idea. {mf|Your Grace|Your Grace|Your Highness|Your Highness}, would you like to hire a new weaponsmith? I'm aware you have a deal with Nazrielle. But if you decide to break that deal and declare me the court's master blacksmith... and allow me to keep Nazrielle as an assistant... oh, I could never thank you enough! What do you say?"

"So that's how it is. Very well. I was prepared for this turn of events. Let's see how well you can handle my new friends." {n}Tiny stone animal figures appear in Sartayne's hands. He scatters them all around him.{/n}

{n}Sartayne sneers and throws his hands up playfully.{/n} "You got me! I confess. Who figured it out? You or her? Anyway, that's not important right now. Why did I do it? Purely for the sake of revenge. Years ago, she invested a lot of effort in devastating my father, who was himself a well-known weaponsmith. He lost everything that was dear to him: his reputation, his workshop – his whole life's purpose."
